adjective.description: Relating to or characteristic of the rule of Herod the Great or his successors of the same name.
Relating to or denoting the Herodians, a biblical Jewish sect.

noun.description: (in the New Testament) a member of a Jewish sect associated with the Pharisees in opposition to Jesus, and assumed to be supporters of Herod the Great's dynasty.
examples: the Herodians joined with the Pharisees
